•	statementModel

reference.description:
Reference of the new model to be selected
Refer to AccountModel.reference

originalModelReference.description:
Reference of the current model to be changed
Must be provided for the following models. :
•	markupFeeModel
•	transactionFeeModel

issuerAddressExternalReference.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

postalAddress.description: Depending on countries, the address format (mainly for line1, line 2, line3, line4 and line5) can have specific conditions such as length restriction. The customer should contact WL to check the address format and have more information.

invalid.description:
The field can be updated only if :
- the address type is POSTAL_MAIL
- the existing value is true

activationEndTime.description: Last point in time at which the override will be considered. Has to be later than ActivationStartTime. Can be present without ActivationStartTime. If not provided the override will be taken into account forever.

activationStartTime.description: First point in time at which the override will be considered. Has to be before ActivationEndTime. Can be present without ActivationEndTime. If not provided the override will be taken into account immediately.

conditionCheck.description: Overrides the default configured for the corresponding restriction attribute. In case JSON null is provided then the default becomes effective.

conditionParameters.description: Overrides the default configured for the corresponding restriction attribute (see configuration entity explanations). An item must not have leading or trailing spaces. Moreover it must not contain any comma. In case JSON null is provided then the default becomes effective.

artwork.description: The issuer can provide another artwork among those allowed in the product configuration. It will be used when the card will be replaced or renewed.

blockingRenewalReasonCode.description: A blocking renewal reason code among those configured for the issuer must be provided if the card renewal process is blocked (NewCardRenewalAllowed is false).

blockingReplacementReasonCode.description: A blocking replacement reason code among those configured for the issuer must be provided if the card replacement process is blocked (NewCardReplacementAllowed is false).

forcedEmbossingName.description:
The issuer can provide or modify the first line of the name embossed on the physical card. It will be used when the card will be replaced or renewed.
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 1 of the embossing name.

forcedEmbossingName2ndLine.description:
The issuer can provide or modify the embossing name 2nd line of the card if the embossing name first line is provided and if allowed within card Technology and Application model.
It will be used when the card will be replaced or renewed.
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 2 of the embossing name.
To reset the embossing name 2nd line of the card, the value "" or null must be provided.

schemeDeclarationOptOut.description:
The issuer can update this indicator used to declare the card event to the scheme (ABU/VAU report).
The default value depends on the product configuration.

newCardRenewalAllowed.description: The card renewal process can be blocked (blocking renewal reason code must be provided) or not.

newCardReplacementAllowed.description: The card replacement process can be blocked (blocking replacement reason code must be provided) or not.

vipFlag.description:
Indicates if the holder of the priority pass is a VIP or not. This information is used to determine the priority pass fees to apply.
If true, VIP fees are applied. 
If false, standard fees are applied.

specificFields.description: Refer to CardContract.specificFields

selectedModels.description: The issuer can replace one or several models linked to the card contract by another one allowed in the product configuration.

cardClass.description:
The issuer can provide another card class among those allowed in the product configuration. 
Refer to CardContract.cardClass

photoReference.description: A new photo reference can be provided (used for next cards in case of renewal, replacement).

pictureReference.description: A new picture reference can be provided (used for next cards in case of renewal, replacement).

logoReference.description: A new logo reference can be provided for corporate card only (used for next cards in case of renewal, replacement).

deviceTokensNumber.description: The issuer can provide the number of device tokens on the card attached to the card contract

merchantTokensNumber.description: The issuer can provide the number of merchant tokens on the card attached to the card contract

authorizationDataValidation.description: The issuer can update cardholder data used by the Front Office for verification.

issuerBranchCode.description: Issuer branch code to be modified

deliveryChannel.description: Specify the channel for letter delivery to update

feeReimbursementAtCardContractClosing.description: Parameter used to specify if membership fee has to be reimbursed in case of card contract closing.

numberOfFreeCardsMembershipFee.description:
The issuer can provide or modify the number of cards for which membership fee is not generated (free cards).
If not provided, the default value will be used if defined at product level.

numberOfFreeCardsAccountSetupFee.description:
The issuer can provide or modify the number of cards for which account setup fee is not generated  (free cards).
If not provided, the default value will be used if defined at product level.

numberOfFreeCardsPrimaryCardImpacted.description:
The issuer can indicate if the primary card is always the first card to be considered as free and then the additional cards if any will be considered  (true) or if only additional cards can be free (false)

E.g. Number of cards for which membership fee is not generated = 2
If the flag is True, the Primary card and only 1 additional card have no membership fee.
If the flag is False, membership fee is generated for the primary card and only 2 additional card have no membership fee.

specificFields.description: Refer to Contract.specificFields

waiveFee.description: whether contract fees (membership and account setup) are both waived during contract fee calculation (at contract creation, anniversary date, etc)

membershipFeeAnniversaryDate.description: Anniversary date of the membership fee can be changed when the fee frequency is Yearly

addresses.description:
Each provided address must have
- an addressLabel among the ones configured such as MAIN_POSTAL_ADDRESS
- an address type to indicate whether it a postal, an e-mail or a phone number
- the address itself depending on its type: MailAddress, EmailAddress or PhoneNumber
Each provided address can have
- none, 1,... N address usages - such address usage can be used to retrieve the address related to a business process  (e.g. CARD_DELIVERY used to identify the address to be used to send the card to the cardholder). If there is no address usage the Main postal address is used
- startDate: this is the date when the provided address becomes valid (this date is always greater than the current date). If not provided this is by default the current date.
As a result, each contract member is updated with provided addresses.

startDate.description:
If the date is not provided, the current date and time of the user’s request is used.
If the provided date corresponds to the current date, the provided time is ignored and replaced by the current time of the system.
If the provided date is in the future (at least current date +1), provided date and time are used only if the LABEL of the address is already existing for the customer. In case the time is not provided, the time is set up to the start of the day (e.g. ‘T00:00:00’)
In all cases, if the address is created for the first time for a given LABEL, both date and time of the system are used and the address is immediately active. 
For generic definition, refer to Address.startDate.

invalid.description:
The issuer can:
- either invalidate the address of all members of the contract by setting this flag to True and providing only the addressLabel and the addressType (limited to address type as postalAddress in this release)
- or validate the address of all members of the contract by setting this flag to False and providing the addressLabel, the addressType and the valid Address (limited to address type as postalAddress in this release)
Indicates if the address is invalid or not (limited to address type as postalAddress in this release)

selectedModels.description: Fee Model used for the contract (mandatory, Account setup fee and/or Membership fee models).

accountIdentifier.description: Contract fees related account identifier

instalmentModelReference.description: External Reference of a credit instalment model

creditAmount.description: The amount to be converted into instalment. excluding all interest and fees.

instalmentTerm.description: Number of months for instalment repayment.

customerIdentifier.description: Unique identifier. Refer to Customer Identifier data type for detail information

firstInstalmentDate.description:
In case the repayment day type is “fixed calendar day”, this field needs to be filled with a default value which can be overridden at the Instalment contract creation time.
Only a fixed day between 1 and 25 of the month is allowed in the current version. Other values can be added in the future releases.
Default value will be taken from the instalment model, where it is derived from RepaymentDayType. If RepaymentDayType  is not provided the error will be returned

receivingAccountIdentifier.description: Receiving account number which relates to the account credited.

payingAccountIdentifier.description: Paying account number, which is assigned for credit instalment repayment posting.

isChargeAnticipated.description: Indicator of the charge anticipated interest and fee indicator on early contract termination.

instalmentContractIdentifier.description: External Reference of the Instalment Contract.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can update the list of external data related to the cardHolder during the card replacement.
A new data can be added or an existing data can be updated (label1 = new value) or removed ( (label1 = null).
Any existing data that is not present in this list is not updated in the card contract.
Refer to Customer.specificFields

vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities applicable to the customer.

vulnerabilityIndicator.description: indicates if the client is vulnerable

vulnerabilityNote.description: note about the client's vulnerability (free text)

closingDate.description: Closing Date to be provided when closure delay type = SCHEDULED. In this case, the closing date must be greater than the current date.

closureDelayType.description:
Type of the closure delay
Possibles values :
- IMMEDIATE for an immediate contract closing
- SCHEDULED for a contract closing at a provided date

feeReimbursementAtCardContractClosing.description:
Indicates if the related membership/account setup fees must be partially reimbursed.
If not provided, the default value at MembershipFeeModel and AccountSetupFeeModel levels will be applied.

deliveryChannel.description:
Specify the channel for letter delivery to be updated for the account of an entity of the company organization.
Currently, only the values WEB, LETTER or LETTER_AND_WEB can be used.

advertisementFlags.description: Advertisement channels can be updated for the account of an entity of the company organization.

customers.description:
The issuer has to provide all new customers (as person) which don't already exist in our system in a dedicated list (customers).
For each new customer, the issuer :
- can provide an unique external reference: whether this external reference is already assigned to an existing customer for this issuer in our system then the contract creation request is denied
- must provide mandatory fields and a correlation id that can be used in the contract part to assign the customer, not yet created in our system, as contract owner, root or card account owner, cardholder, etc

companies.description:
The issuer has to provide companies which don't already exist in our system in a dedicated list (companies).
For each new company, the issuer :
- can provide an unique external reference: whether this external reference is already assigned to an existing company for this issuer in our system then the contract creation request is denied
- must provide mandatory fields and a correlation id that can be used in the contract part to assign the company, not yet created in our system, as contract owner, root or card account owner etc

addCorporateContractEntity.description: It is possible to add an entity (e.g. country, division, department) into the company organization of an existing corporate contract (configured in a product extension).

customers.description:
The issuer has to provide customers (here usually 1 employee only) which don't already exist in our system in a dedicated list (customers).
For each new customer, the issuer :
- can provide an unique external reference: whether this external reference is already assigned to an existing customer for this issuer in our system then the cards and accounts creation request is denied
- must provide mandatory fields and a correlation id that can be used in the addCorporateEmployeeCardsAndAccounts part to assign the customer, not yet created in our system, as card account owner, cardholder, etc

addCorporateEmployeeCardsAndAccounts.description:
It is possible to add one or several employees with cards and accounts (configured in a product extension).
Usually this API is used to add one employee only with its new card and card account.

customers.description:
The issuer has to provide all new customers (as person) which don't already exist in our system in a dedicated list (customers).
For each new customer, the issuer :
- can provide an unique external reference: whether this external reference is already assigned to an existing customer for this issuer in our system then the contract creation request is denied
- must provide mandatory fields and a correlation id that can be used in the contract part to assign the customer, not yet created in our system, as contract owner, root or card account owner, cardholder, etc

companies.description:
The issuer has to provide companies which don't already exist in our system in a dedicated list (companies).
For each new company, the issuer :
- can provide an unique external reference: whether this external reference is already assigned to an existing company for this issuer in our system then the contract creation request is denied
- must provide mandatory fields and a correlation id that can be used in the contract part to assign the company, not yet created in our system, as contract owner, root or card account owner etc

addCorporateContractEntities.description: With the corporate contract creation request it is possible to add an entity (e.g. country, division, department) into the company organization (configured in a product extension).

addCorporateEmployeeCardsAndAccounts.description: With the corporate contract creation request it is possible to add one or several employees with cards and accounts (configured in a product extension).

addCorporateVcaServiceCardsAndAccounts.description: With the corporate contract creation request it is possible to add one or several virtual cards and accounts (configured in a product extension).

CreateCorporateContractRequestContract.description: The issuer must provide data related to the contract.

issuerProductExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the external reference of the product to be used to create the corporate contract.

issuerContractExternalReference.description:
The issuer can provide an external reference (e.g. used as contract identifier in Issuer's system). This latter can be used by the issuer to identify, retrieve the contract later, etc.
If not provided by the issuer, it is filled by default with the contract reference generated by our system.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide Specific Fields for the new contract.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card (pass-thru data).

contractOwnerRequestCorrelationId.description:
If the contract owner does not exist in our system as customer or company, the issuer must provide the correlation id of the new customer related to it (defined in the data block CreateCorporateContractRequest.Customer or in CreateCorporateContractRequest.Customer).
It can be a customer or a company.

contractOwner.description:
If the contract owner already exists in our system as customer or company, the issuer must provide either the customerReference or the issuerCustomerExternalReference related to it.
If the contract owner does not exist in our system then the contractOwnerRequestCorrelationId has to be filled.
It can be a customer or a company.

statementDuplicatedForCompany.description:
The issuer can indicate if the company receives a duplicate for statement generated by other paying accounts in the corporate contract (true). By default, the value is false.
E.g. A card account is paid by the cardholder itself, the company can receive a duplicate of its statement.

hierarchyDefaultResetCreditLimit.description: The issuer can indicate, for a Corporate contract only, the default value at contract level to be applied for each account if the Open-to-buy should be reset to its maximum Credit limit at Authorization system side as soon as an account cycle is closed. Of course the amount due (minimum payment amount) is considered as to be repaid by the customer by our solution.

logoReference.description: The issuer can provide the default logo reference to be used for each card issued from this corporate contract.

dispatchCode.description: The issuer can provide the default dispatch code to be used by the embosser to send cards to the right addressee.

postingAccountForMembershipFee.description:
The issuer can indicate if the membership fees have to be posted to employee card accounts or to the root (usually paid by the company) as default value for the corporate contract.
Possible values:
- ROOT_ACCOUNT 
- CARD_ACCOUNT

postingAccountForAccountSetupFee.description:
The issuer can indicate if the account setup fees have to be posted to employee card account or to the root (usually paid by the company) as default value for the corporate contract. 
Possible values:
- ROOT_ACCOUNT 
- CARD_ACCOUNT

corporateContractLevels.description: The issuer can provide the list of all levels of a company organization belonging to the corporate contract.

CreateCorporateContractRequestContract.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.Contract

level.description: The issuer must provide the level number in the company organization (e.g. 1 corresponding to the company, 2 corresponding to country)

levelDescription.description: The issuer must provide the description of the level in the company organization (e.g. Company for level 1, Country for level 2)

CreateCorporateContractRequestCorporateC.description: The issuer must define the first level of the company organization (corresponding to the root entity).

companyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the external reference of the entity within the company organization (e.g. a code representing the country: FRAN for France)

rootAccount.description: The issuer must provide data related to the root account.

deliveryChannel.description:
The issuer can specify the channel for letter delivery used for the root entity (corresponding to the first level of the company organization).
Currently, only the values WEB, LETTER or LETTER_AND_WEB can be used.

advertisementFlags.description: The issuer can specify which advertisement flags are enabled (Email, Letter, Phone, etc.) used for the root entity (corresponding to the first level of the company organization).

CreateCorporateContractRequestCorporateC.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.CorporateContractRootEntity

issuerAccountExternalReference.description:
The issuer can provide the external reference for the new account (maximum length of 255 characters).This external reference must be unique per issuer.
If not provided, the external reference is calculated by our system if a generation algorithm is configured at account hierarchy level (ExternalReferenceGeneratorAlgorithm), else the issuer account external reference will be empty.

accountTemplateReference.description: The issuer must provide the account template reference to identify the account to be created (optional if only one account has to be created in the product extension).

accountOwnerRequestCorrelationId.description:
Not to be provided if the account owner is the same as the contract owner.
Otherwise the issuer can provide the correlation id of the new customer or company which represent the account owner (defined in the data block CreateCorporateContractRequest.Customer or in CreateCorporateContractRequest.Company).

accountOwnerIdentifier.description:
Not to be provided if the account owner is the same as the contract owner.
Otherwise if the account owner already exists in our system then the issuer has to provide the customer reference or the issuer external customer reference of the existing customer or company. If the account owner does not exist in our system then accountOwnerRequestCorrelationId has to be filled.

accountGuarantorRequestCorrelationId.description: The issuer can provide the correlation id of the new customer or company which represent the account guarantor (defined in the data block CreateCorporateContractRequest.Customer or in CreateCorporateContractRequest.Company).

accountGuarantorIdentifier.description: If the account guarantor already exists in our system then the issuer can provide the customer reference or the issuer external customer reference of the existing customer or company.

selectedModels.description:
The issuer can provide specific account model reference, otherwise the default one from the account template is used.

List of possible models:
•	restrictionModel
•	statementModel
•	debitInterestModel
•	creditInterestModel
•	transactionFeeModel
•	markupFeeModel

closureCalendarReference.description: The issuer can provide a specific closure calendar reference, otherwise the default one from the account template is used.

name.description:
The issuer can provide the name of the account.
Refer to Account.name

iban.description:
Refer to Account.iban
Has to be provided except if the payment processing channel is SEPA and SEPA mandate UMR is provided (comes from another system).

ibanOwnerName.description:
Refer to Account.ibanOwnerName
If Issuer expects to produce direct debits and outgoing credit transfers, it is recommended the Iban owner name to be always provided, except if the payment processing channel is SEPA and SEPA mandate UMR is provided (comes from another system).

sepaIndicator.description:
The issuer can indicate if the payment processing channel is SEPA or not (also valid for outgoing credit transfer processing channel).
If payment processing channel is SEPA (SEPA indicator is true) and payment mode is AUTOPAYMENT (Direct debit without confirmation), then SEPA mandate data must be provided.
SEPA indicator default value is false.

creditLimitAmount.description: The issuer can provide a specific credit limit amount (within the minimum/maximum range defined in the restriction model for the credit limit) to replace the default permanent credit limit value.

accountMembershipNumber1.description: The issuer can provide the membership number 1 of the account.

accountMembershipNumber2.description: The issuer can provide the membership number 2 of the account.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the specific fields for the new account.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the account (pass-thru data).

payingAccountType.description:
The paying account type can be provided by the issuer or if not provided it is retrieved from the account template.
In case it is mandatory in the issuer configuration then the provided value should be the same than the one provided for the account hierarchy.

Possible values:
- ROOT_PAYS
- ITSELF_PAYS

See examples described for CreateCorporateContractRequest.AccountHierarchy.hierarchyPayingAccountType

In case no payingAccountType is provided on the account hierarchy, then the possible values are:
- ROOT_PAYS
- ITSELF_PAYS
- ENTITY_PAYS

paymentMode.description:
The payment mode can be provided by the issuer or if not provided it is retrieved from the account template.

Possible values:
- CARDHOLDER_DETERMINED : customer repays its debt by itself (fund transfer to the issuer)
- AUTOPAYMENT : customer repays its debt via Direct Debit (issued by issuer and paid automatically after X days)

noOtbCheck.description:
The issuer can indicate if the Open-to-buy (OTB) must be checked or not when an authorization (authorization system) or a transaction (clearing) is processed.
This can be used when there is no need to check the OTB of an account (e.g. for certain levels of a corporate organization).

resetCreditLimit.description:
The issuer can indicate if the Open-to-buy should be reset to its maximum Credit limit at Authorization system side as soon as a account cycle is closed. Of course the amount due (minimum payment amount) is considered as to be repaid by the customer by our solution.
The default behavior is retrieved from the contract (Corporate only)

liabilityType.description: The issuer can provide the liability type of the new account (free text). This liability type can be different for each issuer and is stored in our solution for information purpose (e.g. can be used for reporting), not used by any business process.

accountDebitOrderDueDateDelay.description: The issuer can provide the debit order due date delay for the new account (number of days). This delay is used to calculate the Direct Debit payment date for each cycle of repayment.

requestCorrelationId.description:
Unique alias provided by the issuer for each new account (Conditional).
During the corporate contract creation processing, this alias is used to assign the new account to contract fees provided in the request

subscriptionDate.description: If provided, this date will be used as the starting date of the add-on subscription.

parameters.description: The issuer can provide a list of parameters related to the addOn.

CreateCorporateContractRequestAccountHie.description: The issuer must provide at least data related to the root account when creating the corporate contract.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide Specific Fields for the new account hierarchy.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the account hierarchy (pass-thru data).

hierarchySelectedModels.description:
The issuer can provide specific account model reference for the account hierarchy, otherwise the default one is used.

List of possible models:     
•	reimbursementModel

hierarchyDebitOrderDueDateDelay.description: The issuer can override the default debit order due date delay defined in the closure calendar.

hierarchyPayingAccountType.description:
The issuer must provide at hierarchy level the paying account type if it is mandatory in the issuer configuration. Then the same value must be provided for each account within this hierarchy or should be the same defined within the account template.

Possible values:
- ROOT_PAYS
- ITSELF_PAYS

Examples:
Case 1: issuer configuration indicates that paying account type is mandatory
. The payingAccountType must be provided at hierarchy level, e.g. ROOT_PAYS
. then for each account to be created the payingAccountType is either provided with value as ROOT_PAYS or is retrieved from account template but must have value as ROOT_PAYS

Case 2: issuer configuration indicates that paying account type is not mandatory
. It is not mandatory to provide a payingAccountType value at hierarchy level
. when creating an account the payingAccountType value can be provided or is retrieved from account template (if provided at hierarchy level then each account must have same value than hierarchy)

CreateCorporateContractRequestAccountHie.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.AccountHierarchy

CreateCorporateContractRequestHierarchyO.description:
The issuer can enable or not each different Outgoing Credit Transfer (OCT) options if this latter is enabled and if can be overriden within the reimbursement model.
E.g. the periodicOCT is allowed in the reimbursement model, default choice, and it is not possible to override this choice. When creating the account hierarchy it is not possible to change this configuration and to not allow this option.

periodicOctAllowed.description: The issuer can enable or disable the periodic OCT option, if it is possible within the reimbursement model to change the default choice.

periodicOctType.description:
The issuer can override the periodic OCT type if allowed within the reimbursment model.
Possibles values:
- DAILY = OCT can be triggered on a daily basis if account is in credit position
- CYCLIC = OCT can be triggered at cycle closure date if account is in credit position

periodicMaxThreshold.description:
The issuer can override the maximum threshold amount defined for periodic OCT if allowed within the reimbursment model, where maximum threshold amount provides lower limit for OCT amount calculation, i.e., if maximum threshold amount is provided, the OCT amount will be equal not to card account credit balance but to account credit balance – maximum threshold amount instead.
E.g. maximum threshold amount as 10.000€: if credit balance is 15.000€ then OCT is issued with amount equal to 15.000-10.000 = 5.000€. If credit balance is 9.000€ then OCT is issued.

octOnContractTerminationAllowed.description: The issuer can enable or disable the OCT on contract termination, if it is possible within the reimbursement model to change the default choice.

octOnDemandAllowed.description: The issuer can enable or disable the OCT on demand, if it is possible within the reimbursement model to change the default choice.

octOnDemandLimitType.description:
The issuer can override the limit type of the OCT on demand if allowed within the reimbursement 
Possible values:
- BALANCE = a customer can only request an OCT in case of account in credit position
- OTB (open-to-buy) = a customer can request an OCT from its current Open-to-buy (so from its credit limit allowed by the issuer)

octOnAccountTerminationAllowed.description:
The issuer can enable or not each different Outgoing Credit Transfer (OCT) options if this latter is enabled and if can be overriden within the reimbursement model.
E.g. the periodicOCT is allowed in the reimbursement model, default choice, and it is not possible to override this choice. When creating the account hierarchy it is not possible to change this configuration and to not allow this option.

CreateCorporateContractRequestHierarchyO.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.HierarchyOutgoingCreditTransferFeature

requestCorrelationId.description:
Unique alias provided by the issuer for each new customer.
During the corporate contract creation processing, this alias is used to assign a new customer to certain customer roles (cardholder, contract owner, account owner, guarantor).

specificFields.description: Refer to Customer.specificFields

requestCorrelationId.description: Unique alias provided by the issuer for each new company. During the contract creation processing, this alias is used to assign a new company to certain company roles (contract owner, account owner, guarantor).

issuerCustomerExternalReference.description: Customer (as company) identifier provided by the Issuer

specificFields.description: Refer toCompany.specificFields

addresses.description: The HEAD_OFFICE has to be provided.

contacts.description: The issuer can provide data related to the contacts of the company.

name.description: The contact name has to be provided if the department name is not provided.

departmentName.description: The department name has to be provided if the contact name is not provided.

description.description: Refer to Contact.description

issuerProductExtensionExternalReference.description: The issuer provides the reference of the product extension to be used to add a new entity in the company organization.

level.description:
The issuer must provide the level number of the new entity in the company organization (e.g. 2 corresponding to country). 
The level must be greater than 1 (the level 1 being the root entity level).

companyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the external reference of the new entity within the company organization (e.g. a code representing the country: FRAN for France). This reference is unique in the corporate contract.

parentCompanyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the external reference of the parent entity to which the entity has to be attached.

deliveryChannel.description:
The issuer can specify the channel for letter delivery used for the entity (corresponding to an entity of the company organization except the root entity).
Currently, only the values WEB, LETTER or LETTER_AND_WEB can be used.

advertisementFlags.description: The issuer can specify which advertisement flags are enabled (Email, Letter, Phone, etc.) used for the entity (corresponding to an entity of the company organization except the root entity).

corporateContractEntityAccounts.description: The issuer must provide the list of accounts for the new entity.

account.description: Data related to each account have to be provided.

issuerProductExtensionExternalReference.description: The issuer provides the reference of the product extension to be used to add an employee, its card(s) and account(s). Usually an employee is added with its corporate card and related card account.

parentCompanyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the external reference of the parent company entity to which the employee cards and accounts have to be attached.

corporateEmployeeAccounts.description: Data related to each employee account have to be provided.

companyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the value of the external reference of the company entity.

corporateEmployeeCards.description: Data related to each employee card have to be provided.

issuerProductExtensionExternalReference.description: The issuer provides the reference of the product extension to be used to add corporate service virtual card and account

parentCompanyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the external reference of the parent company entity under which the VCA service virtual card needs to be created

corporateEmployeeAccounts.description: Data related to each VCA service virtual card account has to be provided.

companyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer must provide the value of the external reference of the company entity.

corporateEmployeeVcaServiceCards.description: Data related to the corporate VCA service card accounts to be provided

deliveryChannel.description:
The issuer can specify the channel for letter delivery used for this account.
Currently, only the values WEB, LETTER or LETTER_AND_WEB can be used.

advertisementFlags.description: The issuer can specify which advertisement flags are enabled (Email, Letter, Phone, etc.).

waiveFee.description: The issuer can indicate if contract related fees, membership fee and account setup fee, are waived (true) or not (false, by default) for this employee account.

postingAccountForMembershipFee.description:
The issuer can indicate if the membership fees are paid by the employee (posted to its card account) or by the company (can be posted to the root currently) if the value is different from the default one defined at corporate contract level. 
Possible values:
- ROOT_ACCOUNT 
- CARD_ACCOUNT

postingAccountForAccountSetupFee.description:
The issuer can indicate if the account setup fees are paid by the employee (posted to its card account) or by the company (can be posted to the root currently) if the value is different from the default one defined at corporate contract level.
Possible values:
- ROOT_ACCOUNT 
- CARD_ACCOUNT

contractFee.description: The issuer can replace both default membership fee and account set up fee models for each account (usually card account).

account.description: The issuer must provide data related to the employee account.

accountSetupFeeModelReference.description: Account setup fee model to be used for the account

membershipFeeModelReference.description: Membership fee model to be used for the account

CreateCorporateContractRequestCardContra.description:
Data related to each card contract and card have to be provided.
If there is no card at creation time then no data to be provided.

issuerCardContractExternalReference.description:
The issuer can provide the external reference for the new card contract.
Refer to CardContractIdentifier.cardContractReference.

artwork.description: The issuer can provide the artwork to be used for the card contract creation, among those allowed, instead of the default one retrieved from the card template.

cardHolderRequestCorrelationId.description:
Not to be provided if the cardholder is the same as the account owner of the default account of the card.
Otherwise the issuer can provide the correlation id of the new customer which represent the cardholder (defined in the data block CreateCorporateContractRequest.Customer).

cardHolderIdentifier.description:
Not to be provided if the cardholder is the same as the account owner of the default account of the card.
If the cardholder already exists in our system then the issuer has to provide the customer reference or the issuer external customer reference of the existing customer.
If the cardholder does not exist in our system then cardholderRequestCorrelationId has to be filled.

issuerBranchCode.description: The issuer can provide the issuer branch code of the card contract. If not provided, then the contract issuer branch code is used.

forcedEmbossingName.description:
The first line of the name to be embossed on the physical card for the new card can be provided.
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 1 of the embossing name.

forcedEmbossingName2ndLine.description:
The second line of the name to be embossed on the physical card for the new card can be provided (if allowed by the product configuration).
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 2 of the embossing name.

selectedModels.description:
The issuer can replace one or several card contract models by providing new card contract model references, otherwise the default ones from the card contract template are used.

List of possible models that can be replaced:
•	cardEventFeeModel 
•	distributionModel                            
•	cardCreationModel

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the Specific Fields for the new card contract.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card contract (pass-thru data)

photoReference.description:
The issuer can provide the photo reference for the new card.
Refer to Card.photoReference

pictureReference.description:
The issuer can provide the picture reference for the new card.
Refer to Card.pictureReference

logoReference.description: A logo reference can be provided for corporate card only (is also used for next cards in case of renewal, replacement).

CreateCorporateContractRequestCardContra.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.CardContract

CreateCorporateContractRequestVcaService.description: Data related to each VCA service virtual card contract needs to be provided

issuerCardContractExternalReference.description: The issuer can provide the external reference for the new card contract.

cardHolderRequestCorrelationId.description:
Not to be provided if the cardholder is the same as the account owner of the default account of the card.
Otherwise the issuer can provide the correlation id of the new customer which represent the cardholder (defined in the data block CreateCorporateContractRequest.Customer).

cardHolderIdentifier.description:
Not to be provided if the cardholder is the same as the account owner of the default account of the card.
If the cardholder already exists in our system then the issuer has to provide the customer reference or the issuer external customer reference of the existing customer.
If the cardholder does not exist in our system then cardholderRequestCorrelationId has to be filled.

issuerBranchCode.description: The issuer can provide the issuer branch code of the card contract. If not provided, then the contract issuer branch code is used.

selectedModels.description:
The issuer can replace one or several card contract models by providing new card contract model references, otherwise the default ones from the card contract template are used.

List of possible models that can be replaced:
•	cardEventFeeModel 
•	distributionModel                            
•	cardCreationModel

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the Specific Fields for the new card contract.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card contract (pass-thru data)

forcedEmbossingName.description:
The first line of the name to be embossed on the physical card for the new card can be provided.
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 1 of the embossing name.
Default value is set to "VCAForcedname"

CreateCorporateContractRequestVcaService.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.VcaServiceCardContract

CreateCorporateContractRequestCard.description: Card related data to be provided for the creation of the card.

pan.description: The issuer can provide the Primary Account Number (PAN) or card number if this is allowed by the product configuration only. The provided PAN must belong to the card product BIN range.

issuerCardExternalReference.description:
The issuer can provide the external reference for the new card (maximum length is 50 characters). This external reference must be unique per issuer.
If not provided, the card will not have an external reference.

embossingLine5.description: The issuer must provide the embossing line 5 if required within card Technology and Application model. Otherwise the issuer can provide it and the embossing line 5 will be sent to the embosser.

expiryDate.description:
The issuer can provide the expiry date of the card if allowed by the product configuration (note that the provided expiry date must belong to the range allowed by the product, e.g. [expiry date calculated by our system - 12 months, expiry date calculated by our system + 12 months].
If provided and not allowed then an error is raised.
Format is MMYY (month and year).

pinInheritanceCardReference.description:
The issuer can provide the card reference of an existing card in our system from which PIN is inherited.
If the provided card reference does not exist in the system, no PIN inheritance is performed.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the Specific Fields for the new card.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card (pass-thru data).

CreateCorporateContractRequestCard.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.Card

CreateCorporateContractRequestVcaService.description: Card related data to be provided for the creation of the card.

issuerCardExternalReference.description:
The issuer can provide the external reference for the new card (maximum length is 50 characters). This external reference must be unique per issuer.
If not provided, the card will not have an external reference.

expiryDate.description:
The issuer can provide the expiry date of the card if allowed by the product configuration (note that the provided expiry date must belong to the range allowed by the product, e.g. [expiry date calculated by our system - 12 months, expiry date calculated by our system + 12 months].
If provided and not allowed then an error is raised.
Format is MMYY (month and year).

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the Specific Fields for the new card.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card (pass-thru data).

CreateCorporateContractRequestVcaService.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.VcaServiceCard

CreateCorporateContractRequestCardOrder.description:
The issuer can provide data related to the card order if physical card is requested.
If not provided and required then the default sending mode is retrieved from product configuration.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the Specific Fields for the card order.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card order provided to the embosser (pass-thru data).

cardProducer.description: The issuer can provide the card producer if it is different than the default one (defined in the card profile).

sendingMode.description:
The issuer can provide the sending mode if a physical card (card order) is requested. Default sending mode is retrieved from configuration.
Example: Normal, Urgent, Ultra Urgent

skipCardOrderGeneration.description:
If this field is true, the card order will not be generated (no plastic).
By default, a card order is requested (except if it is a virtual card configured in the Technology and Application model).

CreateCorporateContractRequestCardOrder.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.CardOrder

CreateCorporateContractRequestPinMailerO.description:
The issuer can provide data related to a PIN mailer order if it is configured as required in the PIN production model.
If not provided and required then the default sending mode is retrieved from product configuration.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the Specific Fields for the PIN mailer order.
It is a list of values (label:value|) related to the card order provided to the embosser (pass-thru data).

sendingMode.description:
The issuer can provide the sending mode if  a PIN mailer (PIN mailer order) is requested. Default sending mode is retrieved from configuration.
Example: Normal, Urgent, Ultra Urgent

skipPinMailerOrderGeneration.description:
The issuer can provide data related to a PIN mailer order if it is configured as required in the PIN production model.
If not provided and required then the default sending mode is retrieved from product configuration.

CreateCorporateContractRequestPinMailerO.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.PinMailerOrder

CreateCorporateContractRequestSepaMandat.description: The issuer must provide SEPA mandate if payment processing channel is SEPA (SEPA indicator is true) and payment mode is AUTOPAYMENT

mandateContractId.description: Mandate underlying contract identifier (external reference) used by the issuer. E.g., if the mandate is set up along with the contract creation, it may contain the application number, etc.

debtorId.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorName.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorAddressType.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorPostalAddress.description: Address lines 1 and 2, street name, building number, post code, town name, country and country subdivision can be provided in certain cases - refer to SEPA rules when debtor's address is required.

mandateNatureType.description:
SEPA mandate nature type. PAPER_MANDATE is taken as a default.
List of mandate possible nature types (for future usage only, not to be used):
COMPUTING_MIGRATION_NO_SIGNATURE, COMPUTING_MIGRATION_WITH_SIGNATURE, FR_MIGRATION_DOMESTIC_FILES,
MANDATE_FROMDIGITALIZATION, e_MANDATE, SIGNATURE_MANDATE, MYBANK_e_MANDATE, IDEAL_e_MANDATE

mandateSignDate.description: The mandate signature date has to be provided except if the SEPA mandate UMR is provided (comes from another system).

sepaMandateUmr.description: Unique reference to identify the SEPA mandate. Can be provided to our system if mandate is created explicitly by another system.

validateMandate.description:
Deprecated field - not to be used
Not to be overridden, as there is a risk for an internal business process.

futureMandateExternalReference.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

CreateCorporateContractRequestSepaMandat.title: CreateCorporateContractRequest.SepaMandate

corporateEmployeeAccount.description: The issuer can modify some data related to an employee account .

contractFee.description: The issuer can replace both membership fee and account set up fee models for each account (usually card account).

companyEntityExternalReference.description: The issuer can modify the value of the external reference of the employee account

deliveryChannel.description:
Specify the channel for letter delivery to be updated for the account.
Currently, only the values WEB, LETTER or LETTER_AND_WEB can be used.

advertisementFlags.description: Advertisement channels can be updated for the account

waiveFee.description: Whether contract fees (membership and account setup) are both waived during contract fee calculation (at contract creation, etc)

postingAccountForMembershipFee.description:
The issuer can change if the membership fees are paid by the employee (posted to its card account), intermediate account (posted to entity account) or by the company (can be posted to the root currently) if the value is different from the default one defined at corporate contract level.
Possible values:
- ROOT_ACCOUNT 
- CARD_ACCOUNT
- ENTITY_ACCOUNT

postingAccountForAccountSetupFee.description:
The issuer can change if the account setup fees are paid by the employee (posted to its card account), intermediate account (posted to entity account) or by the company (can be posted to the root currently) if the value is different from the default one defined at corporate contract level.
Possible values:
- ROOT_ACCOUNT 
- CARD_ACCOUNT
- ENTITY_ACCOUNT

entityIdentifierMembershipFeePosting.description: It is mandatory to provide one of the attributes of this data type in case postingAccountForMembershipFee = ENTITY_ACCOUNT. The issuer will provide the exact entity on which Membership Fee will be posted

entityIdentifierAccountSetupFeePosting.description: It is mandatory to provide one of the attributes of this data type in case postingAccountForAccountSetupFee = ENTITY_ACCOUNT. The issuer will provide the exact entity on which Account Setup Fee will be posted

accountSetupFeeModelReference.description: Account setup fee model to be used for the account

membershipFeeModelReference.description: Membership fee model to be used for the account

legitimacyDocumentType.description: Type of the legitimacy document (example: passport) to be modified

legitimacyDocumentId.description: Id of the legitimacy document (example: the number of the passport)  to be modified

legitimacyDocumentDate.description: Date of the legitimacy document to be modified

legitimacyDocumentExpiryDate.description: Expiry date of the legitimacy document to be modified

legitimated.description: Indicates if the document is legitimated. Can be modified

legitimacyDocumentExpiryDate.description: Expiry date of the legitimacy document

legitimated.description: Indicates if the document is legitimated

cardHolderIdentifier.description: identification of the card holder in the contract that will become the contract owner and therefore hold the principal card

cardContractIdentifier.description: in case the card holder hold more than one card, identification of the card contract that will become the principal one

principalSupplementaryCardIndicator.description:
Indicates if it is a Principal card or an additional card (mandatory)
Possible values: PRINCIPAL, SUPPLEMENTARY

targetProductIdentifier.description: Target product of the product change identified either by the Issuer Product External Reference or the Product Reference.

closingReason.description:
Closing reason used at the contract termination.
Free text

feeReimbursementAtCardContractClosing.description: Indicates whether the membership & account setup fees shall be reimbursed for the old contract at the contract termination (per card contract)

cardCreationSendingMode.description:
Sending mode used for all physical cards ordered in the contract
Same value as provided in the Product change request

pinMailerSendingMode.description:
Sending mode used for all PIN mailers created for the contract
Same value as provided in the Product change request

cardChanges.description:
List of card changes requested during the product change (optional).
Same value as provided in the Product change request

productChangeTrigger.description:
This field indicates when the product change is triggered once the product change request is received. 
It depends of the product change configuration.
Possible values are : 
- IMMEDIATE
- ON_RENEWAL

productChangeReference.description: External reference of the configured Product Change definition used for the product change.

productChangeStatus.description:
Status of the product change
Possible values are :
- PENDING (for scheduled product change, date not reached)
- PROCESSED (for immediate product change, or scheduled product change when date is reached)
- CANCELLED (When a scheduled product change is cancelled before the scheduled product change date is reached)

futureChangeDate.description:
Future date of the product change. 
Calculated by the system in case of product change on renewal (= anticipated card renewal date (when only one card) or first anticipated card renewal date within the contract when contract has several cards).
UTC time zone.
Format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ"

productChangeStatusDate.description:
Date the status of the product change was last updated.
UTC time zone.
Format: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ"

targetProductIdentifier.description: Target product to be used for the product change to create the new contract  identified either by the Issuer Product External Reference or the Product Reference.

closingReason.description: Closing reason to be used when the old contract is terminated (Free text).

feeReimbursementAtCardContractClosing.description: Indicates whether the membership & account setup fees shall be reimbursed for the old contract at the contract termination (per card contract)

cardCreationSendingMode.description: Sending mode applied to all physical cards,  in the new contract, sent to embosser among those allowed as per card product configuration (for physical cards only, if not provided then default one is retrieved from card product configuration if required).

pinMailerSendingMode.description: Sending mode applied to all PIN mailers,  in the new contract, if any and sent to printer among those allowed as per card product configuration (if not provided then default one is retrieved from card product configuration if required).

cardChanges.description:
List of card changes requested during the product change (optional).
(Currently only card class can be changed)

For each card within the new contract, the issuer can provide a new "card class" among the ones allowed by the target product.

cardContractIdentifier.description:
Card contract to which the card change is applied in the new card contract identified either by the Issuer card contract external reference or the Card contract reference.
Mandatory if a card change is requested.

contractIdentifier.description: Identification of the contract either by the Issuer contract external reference or the Contract reference.

status.description:
Current status of the contract.
Refer to Contract.status

productIdentifier.description: Identification of the product change identified either by the Issuer Product External Reference or the Product Reference.

closingDate.description: Date of cloture of the contract

changedContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the new contract either by the Issuer contract external reference or the Contract reference.

accountIdentifier.description: Identification of the account either by the Issuer account external reference or the account reference.

status.description:

changedAccountIdentifier.description: Identification of the new account either by the Issuer account external reference or the account reference.

cardContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the card contract either by the Issuer card contract external reference or the card contract reference.

status.description:
Current status of the card contract.

changedCardContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the new card contract either by the Issuer card contract external reference or the card contract reference.

Current status of the card.

contractIdentifier.description: Identification of the contract either by the Issuer contract external reference or the Contract reference.

status.description:

signatureDate.description: Date of signature of the contract

originalContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the original contract either by the Issuer contract external reference or the Contract reference.

accountIdentifier.description: Identification of the account either by the Issuer account external reference or the account reference.

root.description: Indicate whether this account is the root account or not.

Refer to Account.status

originalAccountIdentifier.description: Identification of the new account either by the Issuer account external reference or the account reference.

cardContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the card contract either by the Issuer card contract external reference or the card contract reference.

status.description:
Current status of the card contract.
Refer to CardContract.status

principalSupplementaryCardIndicator.description: Indicates whether the card is a Principal or Supplementary card.

originalCardContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the original card contract either by the Issuer card contract external reference or the card contract reference.

cardIdentifier.description: Identification of the card either by the Issuer card external reference or the card reference.

pan.description: Pan (depends on user rights)

status.description:
Current status of the card.
Refer to Card.status

orderIdentifier.description: Identification of the order either by the Issuer order external reference or the order reference.

currentInternalStatus.description:
Current status of the order.
Refer to Order.currentInternalStatus

feeReimbursementAtCardContractClosingFor.description: Indicates if the related membership/account setup fees must be partially reimbursed after the closure of the changed contract in case of cancellation of an already processed product change.

contractIdentifier.description: Identification of the contract either by the Issuer contract external reference or the Contract reference.
Identification of the contract either by the Issuer contract external reference or the Contract reference.

productIdentifier.description: Identification of the product change identified either by the Issuer Product External Reference or the Product Reference.

closingDate.description: Date of cloture of the contract

accountIdentifier.description: Identification of the account either by the Issuer account external reference or the account reference.

root.description:
Indicates if the account is the root account of the account hierarchy.
Refer to Account.root

status.description:
Current status of the account.
Refer to Account.status

status.description:
Current status of the card contract.
Refer to CardContract.status
