productIdentifier.description: Identification of the product change identified either by the Issuer Product External Reference or the Product Reference.

status.description:
Current status of the contract.
Refer to Contract.status

closingDate.description: Date of cloture of the contract

accountIdentifier.description: Identification of the account either by the Issuer account external reference or the account reference.

root.description: Indicate whether this account is the root account or not.

status.description:
Current status of the account.
Refer to Account.status

cardContractIdentifier.description: Identification of the card contract either by the Issuer card contract external reference or the card contract reference.

status.description:
Current status of the card contract.
Refer to CardContract.status

cardIdentifier.description: Identification of the permanently blocked card to be transferred into the new contract (if the card has been blocked after a product change request), not in cancelled status, but in the status configured in the target product.

blockingReason.description: Blocking reason of the new card

payingAccountType.description:
For a certain corporate contract it is possible to change the paying account type for all accounts from paid by the account itself (usually paid by the employee) to paid by the root account (usually paid by the company) or the inverse.

Possible values:
ROOT_PAYS
ITSELF_PAYS

Refer to Account.payingAccountType

status.description: status of account

futureUpdate.description: in case change of payer cannot be executed immediately, future update scheduled for the account

payingAccountType.description: new paying account type for contract

futureChangeDate.description: Indicates the date when the updates will be processed (mandatory)

creationDate.description: Indicates the date when the future update was created (mandatory)

activationEndTime.description:
Last point in time at which the override will be considered.
Has to be later than ActivationStartTime. Can be present without ActivationStartTime.
If not provided the override will be taken into account forever.
Example: 2020-07-28T10:13:15.421Z

activationStartTime.description:
First point in time at which the override will be considered.
Has to be before ActivationEndTime. Can be present without ActivationEndTime.
If not provided the override will be taken into account immediately.
Example: 2020-07-28T10:13:15.421Z

maximumAmount.description:
In most of the cases the value given here will be positive or zero.
In case JSON null is provided what is configured on higher levels becomes effective.
If MaximumAmountCheck = true then a non-null value must be given. Otherwise the field must be absent.

maximumAmountCheck.description: In case JSON null is provided what is configured on higher levels becomes effective.

maximumCount.description:
In case JSON null is provided what is configured on higher levels becomes effective.
If MaximumCountCheck = true then a non-null value must be given. Otherwise the field must be absent.

maximumCountCheck.description: In case JSON null is provided what is configured on higher levels becomes effective.

debtorAddressType.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorId.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorName.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorPostalAddress.description: Address lines 1 and 2, street name, building number, post code, town name, country and country subdivision can be provided in certain cases - refer to SEPA rules when debtor's address is required.

mandateContractId.description: Mandate underlying contract identifier (external reference) used by the issuer. E.g., if the mandate is set up along with the contract creation, it may contain the application number, etc.

mandateNatureType.description:
SEPA mandate nature type. PAPER_MANDATE is taken as a default.
List of mandate possible nature types (for future usage only, not to be used):
COMPUTING_MIGRATION_NO_SIGNATURE, COMPUTING_MIGRATION_WITH_SIGNATURE, FR_MIGRATION_DOMESTIC_FILES, 
MANDATE_FROMDIGITALIZATION, e_MANDATE, SIGNATURE_MANDATE, MYBANK_e_MANDATE, IDEAL_e_MANDATE

mandateSignDate.description: The mandate signature date has to be provided except if the SEPA mandate UMR is provided (comes from another system).

sepaMandateUmr.description: Unique reference to identify the SEPA mandate. Can be provided to our system if mandate is created explicitly by another system.

sepaMandateUir.description:
Deprecated field - not to be used
Unique internal reference of the given mandate. Not to be overridden, as there is a risk for an internal business process.

sepaCreditorId.description:
Deprecated field - not to be used
Will be retrieved from the product itself

debtorIban.description:
Deprecated field - not to be used
iban has been introduced instead.

iban.description:
Customer (debtor) Iban used for the repayments via sepa direct debit.
Has to be provided except if the SEPA mandate UMR is provided (comes from another system).

secondIban.description: Deprecated field - not to be used

debtorBic.description:
Deprecated field - not to be used
bic has been introduced instead.

bic.description: Customer (debtor) Bic used for the repayments via sepa direct debit.

validateMandate.description:
Deprecated field - not to be used
Not to be overridden, as there is a risk for an internal business process.

ibanOwnerName.description:
Customer (debtor) Iban owner name used for the repayments via sepa direct debit.
Has to be provided except if the SEPA mandate UMR is provided (comes from another system).

accountIdentifier.description: Refer to Account.accountIdentifier

cancellationDate.description:
SEPA mandate cancellation date.
A date in the future can be provided (mandate is cancelled when the date is reached), otherwise defaults to the current date (mandate is cancelled immediately).

cancellationReason.description:
SEPA mandate cancellation reason
List of mandate possible cancelation reasons:
(RECEIVED_FINAL,USER_ACTION,
OBSCOLESCENCE,
REFUSED,
REVOCATION_ASKED_BY_DEBTOR,
REVOCATION_ASKED_BY_CREDITOR,
DELETION_ASKED_BY_DEBTOR,
DELETION_ASKED_BY_CREDITOR)

validateMandate.description: Deprecated field – not to be used

cancelMandateOnExternalSystem.description: Deprecated field – not to be used

description.description:
Textual description of the operation
Can contain a free text that can be used when the operation is presented to the Customer

externalOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
External reference of the operation in the caller system to be created.

externalOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The date the operation is performed (in general, the current date should be provided).

externalOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The identifier of the external system which provides the operation to be posted (free text)

externalOperationCode.description: The external operation code of the interest operation can be provided to identify the operation type in the issuer system.

interestType.description:
The issuer must provide the type of Interest for an interest operation
Possible values: CREDIT / DEBIT

referenceAmount.description:
The reference amount has to be provided (amount/exponent/currency values)
If a debit operation is posted, the operation amount has to be positive.
If a credit operation is posted, the operation amount has to be negative.
The currency must be the same as the posting account.

description.description:
Textual description of the operation
Can contain a free text that can be used when the operation is presented to the Customer.

externalMatchingOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationReference of the original operation to be reversed.

externalMatchingOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationDate of the original operation to be reversed.

externalMatchingOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationServicePoster of the original operation to be reversed.

externalOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
External reference of the operation to be created.

externalOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The date the operation is performed (in general, the current date should be provided)

externalOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The identifier of the external system which provides the operation to be posted (free text).

description.description:
Textual description of the operation
Can contain a free text that can be used when the operation is presented to the Customer

bonusProgramReference.description: The issuer must provide the reference of the Bonus/Loyalty program for which the reward is applied.

externalOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
External reference of the operation to be created.

externalOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The date the operation is performed (in general, the current date should be provided).

externalOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The identifier of the external system which provides the operation to be posted (free text)

externalOperationCode.description: The external operation code of the Bonus operation can be provided to identify the operation type in the issuer system.

referenceAmount.description:
The reference amount has to be provided for a monetary operation (amount/exponent/currency values)
If a debit operation is posted, the operation amount has to be positive.
If a credit operation is posted, the operation amount has to be negative.
The currency must be the same as the posting account.

loyaltyPointAmount.description:
The loyalty point amount has to be provided for a non-monetary operation (value/unit)
If a debit operation is posted, the operation amount has to be positive.
If a credit operation is posted, the operation amount has to be negative.
The loyalty point unit must be defined by the Bonus/Loyalty program.

rewardedOperationIdentifier.description:
The issuer can provide the identifier of the operation to be rewarded, if any.
If provided, the triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) has not to be provided.

rewardedExternalMatchingOperationReferen.description:
The issuer can provide the triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) of the operation to be rewarded if any.
If the triplet is provided, the identifier of the operation to be rewarded has not to be provided.
External reference of the operation to be rewarded.

rewardedExternalMatchingOperationDate.description:
The issuer can provide the triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) of the operation to be rewarded if any.
If the triplet is provided, the identifier of the operation to be rewarded has not to be provided.
Operation date of the operation to be rewarded.

rewardedExternalMatchingOperationService.description:
The issuer can provide the triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) of the operation to be rewarded if any.
If the triplet is provided, the identifier of the operation to be rewarded has not to be provided.
Identifier of the external system of the operation to be rewarded.

description.description:
Textual description of the operation
Can contain a free text that can be used when the operation is presented to the Customer.

externalMatchingOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationReference of the original operation to be reversed.

externalMatchingOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationDate of the original operation to be reversed.

externalMatchingOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationServicePoster of the original operation to be reversed.

externalOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
External reference of the operation to be created.

externalOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The date the operation is performed (in general, the current date should be provided)

externalOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The identifier of the external system which provides the operation to be posted (free text).

issuerCustomerExternalReference.description: Customer (as company) identifier provided by the Issuer

active.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

corporateName.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

nationalFiscalIdentifier.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

vatCode.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

type.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

size.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

businessArea.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

activityCode.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

revenue.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

legalForm.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

commercialStatus.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

preferredCorrespondenceLanguage.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

partnerExternalReference.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

specificFields.description: Refer to Company's attribute for more detail

addresses.description:
See Address' resource for details.
The HEAD_OFFICE is mandatory

accountIdentifier.description: Refer to Account.accountIdentifier

exponent.description: Exponent of Amount. Number of decimal digits (mandatory).

isoCode.description:
Currency code of amount (mandatory)
The currency in ISO4217 alphabetic format.
Example: EUR for Euro

value.description:
Integer amount value (mandatory).
Ex. if it is two hundred euros and 17 cents, then amount value is 20017 (exponent = 2 digits for currency=EUR).

permanentlyBlocked.description: Indicates if the card is permanently blocked (true) or not (false). Default value is false

renewed.description: Indicates if the card is renewed (true) or not (false). Default value is false

replaced.description: Indicates if the card is replaced (true) or not (false). Default value is false

samePin.description: Indicate if multi card set shares same PIN

correlationId.description: Wall clock time required from service to generate the response

responseDateTime.description: Timestamp when response date was generated

operationIdentifier.description:
Internal identifier associated to the transaction to which one this transaction is linked. 16-digit incremental number (1000000000000001)
Ex: TRANSACTION_FEE linked to FP (Parent)

acquirerReferenceData.description:
Acquirer Reference Number (ARN) associated to the transaction
- MCI : DE 031 - Acquirer Reference Data
- VISA : TCR0 Acquirer Reference Number pos. 27-49

cardAcceptorCity.description:
Card Acceptor Location (City) associated to the transaction
- MCI : DE 046 s3 - Card Acceptor City
- VISA : TCR0 - Merchant City

cardAcceptorCountry.description:
Card Acceptor Country Code associated to the transaction
- MCI : DE 046 s6 - Card Acceptor Country Code
- VISA : TCR0 - Merchant Country

cardAcceptorName.description:
Complete Card Acceptor Name / Location (Merchant) associated to the transaction
- MCI : DE 046 s1 to s6 - Card Acceptor Name/Location
- VISA : TCR0

description.description: Textual description of the current operation. Can contain a free text that can be used when the operation is presented to the Customer

externalOperationCode.description: Value per operation type posted to an Account determined by our system according to specific Issuer configuration

feeType.description:
Type of fee used to create the current operation. Mandatory if the operation is a fee.
In the case fee is managed within our system, the complete value list is shared with the issuer and can be for example "ACCOUNT_SETUP_FEE", "TRANSACTION_FEE". "EVENT_FEE","CARD_FEE".

merchantCategoryCode.description: Classifies the type of business applicable to the card acceptor

operationCode.description:
Transaction category defined by our system describing the current operation (only for Scheme transaction and load operation). Values:
CASH_ADVANCE,
CASH_BACK
CASH_WITHDRAWAL,
CREDIT,
FUND_TRANSFER,
NORMAL_PURCHASE,
REFUND_PURCHASE
LOAD

operationKind.description:
Indicates the operation kind 
Value =
BAL (balance transfer)
FEE (fee operation)
INT (interest operation)
LOAD (load operation)
PAY (payment operation)
RMB (reimbursement operation)
TRN (transaction operation from scheme)
DISPUTE (refund / redebit operation triggered from our Dispute module)
RST_BAL (reset balance operation)
SUBPAYOP (apportionment operation)
WRITE_OFF (write off - esp account closing)
CRD_INST (instalment operation)
CRD_INST_INIT (Instalment credit operation)
ADJ (balance adjustment operation)

postingDate.description: Date and Time when the transaction is posted to the account

reconciliationAmount.description:
Transaction amount provided by the scheme in the currency agreed between the scheme and the issuer/WL. 
Mandatory for 1st presentment.
Scheme Reconciliation Amount / Currency  / Exponent
- MCI: DE 005 / DE 050 / associated PDS 0148
- VISA: Destination Amount / Destination Currency

reversal.description: This flag indicates if this operation is a reversal (true) or not (false)

reversalReason.description: The reason why the reversal has been created. Determined by the calling service depending information of the original message (conditional) Mandatory, if the operation is reversal

subFeeType.description: Sub Type of internal fee created and impacting the Cardholder Account (free text)

frequency.description: Free text describing the frequency of the operation performed (daily, monthly, yearly...) (optional)

transactionAmount.description:
DE 4 (Amount, Transaction) is the amount of funds the cardholder requested in the currency appearing on the transaction information document (TID), which may be the acquirer’s local currency or a currency acceptable to the cardholder and card acceptor that the acquirer supports, exclusive of PDS 0146 (Amounts, Transaction Fee). If no currency is identified on the TID, the transaction is deemed to have taken place in the currency that is legal tender at the point of interaction.
Amount of the transaction. This field contains numerics. Two decimal positions are implied. If the Original Source Currency code is 392 (Japanese Yen), any value other than zero after the decimal produces an Invalid Amount error.
MCI DE 004
VISA TCR0

transactionDate.description: Date and time when the transaction has been performed by the Cardholder

valueDate.description: The date the operation impacts balances or counters. If not set, the valueDate will be set to operationDate if operationDate is not in the past, today otherwise (conditional)

walletId.description: Indicates the identifier of the wallet (Apple Pay or other token requestor) used for the operation

authorizationBusinessCaseIdentifier.description: Internal identifier provided by the WLP Front Office in each Authorisation Message received. Only present if operation (first presentment) matched with an authorization.

disputeFolderIdentifier.description: Refer to disputeFolderIdentifier object description (technical field)

panTokenIdentifier.description:
Token Requestor Identifier value associated to the transaction
- MCI : PDS 0059 - Token Requestor ID
- VISA : TCR5 Token Requestor ID pos. 149-159

externalOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The date is provided by the caller and must not be modified in case of reprocess (idempotency)

externalOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The reference is provided by the caller and must not be modified in case of reprocess (idempotency)

externalOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The Service Poster depends on the caller. This is a free text. When the  value is ITP, OPC, IDM, CMS, CAS, WLP-CAS or WLP_CAS, operations are considered "internal".

pan.description: Refer to Card.pan (optional)

panReference.description: Pan reference only if the card is associated to the operation

acquisitionMaterial.description:
Only for scheme transaction.
Type of material used to realize the operation.
Possible values:
ATM, POS, INTERNET, MANUAL, VOICE_PHONE, UNATTENDED_TERMINAL, MOBILE, UNKNOWN

cardAcceptorIdCode.description:
Identifies the card acceptor ID assigned by the acquirer. This ID must represent a unique identifier for each merchant name/location within the acquiring BIN.
Card Acceptor (Merchant) Identifier associated to the transaction
- MCI : DE 042 - Card Acceptor ID Code
- VISA : TCR5 - Acquirer's Business ID

entryMode.description:
Precise how the card information have been read. Conversion of the native fields.
Possible values :
UNKNOWN
OCR: Optical Character Reader
MANUAL
MAGSTRIPE: Magnetic Stripe read
CONTACTLESS: Contactless read (called proximity payment or Mobile Chip system)
CHIP: Chip read
BARCODE: Bar Code read

approvalCode.description:
Authorization Approval Code associated to the transaction
* MCI : DE 038 - Approval Code
* VISA : TCR0 Authorization Code pos. 152-157

authorization.description: Data retrieved from the authorization matched to the transaction

pointOfSaleEnvironment.description:
Recurring transaction indicator, indicating that the cardholder
and merchant have agreed to periodic billing for goods and services, such as
utility bills, internet connection, and magazine subscriptions.
Values:
Space = default
R = Recurring Payment Transaction
I = Installment Payment
C = Credential on File

mailPhoneEcommerceAndPaymentIndicator.description:
Mail Phone Ecommerce and Payment Indicator indicates if transaction was initiated as mail order, telephone order or electronic commerce. 
Used in Visa interchange validation and determination.  
Required in input for Visa transactions. 
Base II mapped from Draft data TCR1 position 116. 
Domain: 
Space - Field not applicable or acquirer did not specify.  
1 - Mail/Phone Order (MO/TO). 
2 - Recurring transaction (valid only for U.S. acquired transactions). 
3 - Instalment payment.  
4 - Unknown classification/other mail order.  
5 - Secure Electronic Commerce Transaction. 
6 - Non-Authenticated Security Transaction at a 3-D Secure-capable merchant, and merchant attempted to authenticate the cardholder using 3-D secure. 
7 - Non-Authenticated Security Transaction 
8 - Non-secure transaction. 
9 - For optional regional use only.

pointOfService.description: Represents series of codes that identify terminal capability, terminal environment, and point-of interaction (POI) security data (both for VISA and MCI)

acquirerId.description:
VISA mapping is the following: TC05, TCR0; Field: Acquirer Reference Number POS 27-49. Should be taken positions 2-7 of this field (Acquirer BIN).
MCI mapping is the following: DE 31 Acquirer Reference Data. Should be taken positions 2-7 of this field.

destinationId.description:
VISA mapping is the following: Determined based on transaction data.
MCI mapping is the following: DE 93 transaction Destination Institution ID code.

loyaltyPoint.description: Used when the operation has loyalty points

schemeTransactionIdentifier.description:
This field will contain the transaction identifier, a unique value that schemas assign to each transaction. It can be used to maintain an audit trailthroughout the life cycle of the transaction and all related transactions, such as reversals, adjustments, confirmations, and dispute financials
The corresponding mapping is:
- VISA: TC05 TCR5 payment service, pos 5-19 
- MCI: DE 063 - Transaction Life Cycle ID, subfield 2 - Trace ID

rewardedOperationIdentifier.description: Internal identifier associated to the transaction linked to a Bonus operation 16-digit incremental number (1000000000000001). Used only if a Bonus operation is related to.

lodgingInformation.description: The list of lodging information parameters from the clearing file

carRentalInformation.description: The list of car rental information parameters from the clearing file

airItineraryInformation.description: The list of air itinerary parameters from the clearing file

disputed.description: The attribute shows weather the operation was disputed or not

printOnStatement.description: The attribute shows if the operation is included in the statement or not

cardAcceptorAddress.description: The attribute represents card acceptor address received from scheme

cardAcceptorStateProvinceRegionCode.description: The attribute represents card acceptor state province region code received from scheme

postingAccountIdentifier.description: Identifier of the account on which the operation was posted

status.description:
Status of the transaction 
* PROCESSED
* IN_ERROR
* CAS_IN_DISPUTE (when the transaction is disputed)
* CAS_PENDING

operationType.description: Defines the operation type that is configured in 'Operation type tree' in the Issuer Configuration

transactionDate.description: The date and time on which the transaction was approved. Data is retrieved from the matched authorization transaction.

acquisitionMaterial.description:
Only for scheme transaction.
Type of material used to realize the operation.
Possible values:
ATM, POS, INTERNET, MANUAL, VOICE_PHONE, UNATTENDED_TERMINAL, MOBILE, UNKNOWN

adjustment.description:
This flag indicates if this operation is an adjustment or not.
Value:
true : this operation adjusts already posted operation
false : this operation does not adjust the posted operation

adjustmentReason.description:
The reason why the adjustment has been created. (conditional)
Mandatory when adjustment is true.
 AdjustmentReasonType (DISPUTE_RESULT, COMMERCIAL_ADJUSTMENT, INVALID_OPERATION, ERROR_DURING_ACQUISITION, CONFIGURATION_REPROCESSING)

balanceAdjustmentReason.description:
The reason why the balance adjustment has been requested (conditional)
Mandatory when balance adjustment.
Allowed value list depends on the issuer configuration

alternativeIban.description: Corresponds to PAN token received from the scheme

automaticPayment.description: For credit cards, indicate if it is an automatic payment operation posted to an account in case of direct debit issued to repay an account (this account is automatically paid after N business days)

brand.description: Brand associated to the Issuer Account Range (BIN) such as "MCC" (MasterCard) , "DMC" (Debit MasterCard), "MSI" (Maestro), "CIR" (Cirrus), "VIS" (VISA).

cardAcceptorIdCode.description:
Identifies the card acceptor ID assigned by the acquirer. This ID must represent a unique identifier for each merchant name/location within the acquiring BIN.
Card Acceptor (Merchant) Identifier associated to the transaction
- MCI : DE 042 - Card Acceptor ID Code
- VISA : TCR5 - Acquirer's Business ID

cardAcceptorZipCode.description:
Card Acceptor ZIP Code associated to the transaction
* MCI : DE 046 s4 - Card Acceptor Postal (ZIP) Code
* VISA : TCR0 - Merchant zip code

cardScheme.description: Short name of national or international network, if implicated.

cardTypeCode.description: Scheme Product associated to the Issuer Account Range

cashAmount.description:
Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for Cash Back transaction amount
* MCI : DE 054 s2 = 40 - Amount, Cash Back
* VISA : TCR1 pos. 158-166 Cashback

cashAmountAccountCurrency.description: Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for Cash Back transaction amount converted in Cardholder Account Currency

dccIndicator.description:
This field must contain one of these values (optional):
1 = DCC performed
space = default, no DCC has been performed

debit.description:
Sign associated to the transaction according to the Cardholder side
* D = Cardholder debited
* C = Cardholder credited

directDebitEndToEndId.description: Identifier of the Direct Debit order linked to payment operation

entryMode.description:
Precise how the card information have been read. Conversion of the native fields.
Possible values :
UNKNOWN
OCR: Optical Character Reader
MANUAL
MAGSTRIPE: Magnetic Stripe read
CONTACTLESS: Contactless read (called proximity payment or Mobile Chip system)
CHIP: Chip read
BARCODE: Bar Code read

exchangeRate.description: Used to realize the conversion between the original currency and the account currency (optional)

exchangeRateDate.description: The date of the exchange operation (optional)

exchangeRateSource.description: The source of the exchange rate information. Rate source name or scheme used (optional).

externalMatchingOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for matching the current operation with the original operation.
Mandatory in case of reversal.
The field contains the value of externalOperationDate of the original operation (conditional).

externalMatchingOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for matching the current operation with the original operation.
Mandatory in case of reversal.
The field contains the value of externalOperationReference of the original operation (conditional).

externalMatchingOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system.
It is used for matching the current operation with the original operation.
Mandatory in case of reversal.
The field contains the value of externalOperationServicePoster of the original operation (conditional).

gratuityAmount.description:
Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for Gratuity transaction amount converted by our system in Cardholder Account Currency
Only for MC

gratuityAmountAccountCurrency.description: Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for Gratuity transaction amount converted by our system in Cardholder Account Currency

interestCondition.description: Free zone, used to store description like rates, algorithm and values calculated.

interestStartDate.description: The starting date used to calculate interest. Present for information purpose.

interestEndDate.description: The ending date used to calculate interest. Present for information purpose.

interestType.description: Type of Interest for an interest operation : CREDIT / DEBIT

originatingAccountNumber.description: The account number of the current balance transfer in the previous institution. For information purpose.

originatingInstitution.description: The information about the originating financial institution having this balance. For information purpose.

pan.description: Refer to Card.pan

partialOperation.description: Indicates whether this operation is partial or not.

paymentChannel.description:
Indicates the channel of incoming payment operation from an external system (e.g. bank)
Ex. CHEQUE, CASH, ONLINE_MONEY, NO_CHANNEL_PROVIDED, INSTALMENT, INCOMING_PAYMENT.
INSTALMENT - set for payments generated for CreditInstalmentContract

poiAmount.description: Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for DCC (Dynamic Currency Conversion) transaction amount - Only for MC

poiAmountAccountCurrency.description: Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for DCC (Dynamic Currency Conversion) transaction amount - Only for MC

sepa.description: Indicates if an operation (e.g. incoming payment received from the issuer) was in SEPA format (e.g. SEPA payment).

status.description:
Status of the transaction 
* PROCESSED
* IN_ERROR
* CAS_IN_DISPUTE (when the transaction is disputed)
* CAS_PENDING

surchargeAmount.description: Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for surcharge transaction amount in Transaction Currency

surchargeAmountAccountCurrency.description: Additional Amount / Currency / Exponent for Surcharge transaction amount converted in Cardholder Account Currency

validationMode.description:
Precise how the transaction has been validated. Conversion based on information of the original message
MC : DE 022
VISA : TCR0 POS Entry Mode /Cardholder ID Method/POS Terminal Capability
Possible values: PIN, SIGNATURE, UNKNOWN

terminalId.description: Code that identifies the card acceptor terminal or ATM.

parentOperation.description:
This field is expandable and if needed - shows the list of operations linked to parentOperationIdentifier
Ex: TRANSACTION_FEE linked to FP (Parent)

parentOperationIdentifier.description:
Internal identifier associated to the transaction to which one this transaction is linked. 16-digit incremental number (1000000000000001)
Ex: TRANSACTION_FEE linked to FP (Parent)

overPaymentAccountIdentifier.description: The identifier of the account in overpayment

loyaltyPoint.description: Used when the operation has loyalty points

rewardedOperationIdentifier.description: Internal identifier associated to the transaction linked to a Bonus operation 16-digit incremental number (1000000000000001). Used only if a Bonus operation is related to.

lodgingInformation.description: The list of lodging information parameters from the clearing file

carRentalInformation.description: The list of car rental information parameters from the clearing file

airItineraryInformation.description: The list of air itinerary parameters from the clearing file

subOperationIdentifiers.description: List of suboperation identifiers for the parent operation

correction.description: Represents weather the operation is a correction or not

intermediateAmount.description: Calculated Cardholder Amount after potential Currency Conversion but before adding the Conversion Charge

billingAmount.description:
Cardholder Billing amount
MCI: DE 006 (Scheme Cardholder Billing Amount)
VISA: TCR0 Positions: 62–73 (Destination Amount)

overallExhangeRate.description: Currency Rate shows the rate of the complete conversion from Transaction Amount to Posted Cardholder Amount

includeInOtherDetailFeeAmount.description: Indicates if the detail fee amount is part of another detail fee amount

orderType.description:
The order can correspond to a card, a PIN mailer or a TAN mailer.
Possible values are : CardOrder, PinMailerOrder, TanMailerOrder

orderIdentifier.description:
Unique identifier of the order (mandatory)
Refer to OrderIdentifier data type for detail information

currentExternalStatus.description:
Current external status of the order (optional)
The list of external statuses is configurable per issuer.
The external status can be used to follow the card producing status for the card order e.g. received, embossed, sent, etc.

currentExternalStatusDate.description: Modification date of the last external status of the order (optional)

currentInternalStatus.description:
Current internal status of the order (mandatory)
Possible values: are: CREATED, CONFIRMED, ORDERED, EXTRACTION_FAILED, REJECTED, CANCELLED, FINISHED, ORDERABLE

currentInternalStatusDate.description: Last modification date of the internal status of the order (optional)

sendingMode.description:
Code identifying the desired sending mode for the order (mandatory)
Example: Normal, Urgent, Ultra Urgent

deliveryChannel.description:
Code of the delivery channel for the card
The list of delivery channels is configurable per Issuer.

deliveryType.description:
Indicates whether the delivery of the card should be to branch or customer (instead of the one from the distribution rule of the card product) (optional)
Possible values: CUSTOMER (the card is to be delivered to the customer address, BRANCH (the card is to be delivered to the bank branch)

orderReason.description:
Reason why the order is done (mandatory)
Possible values are: CARD_RENEWAL, PIN_CARD_RENEWAL, FIRST_CARD_ISSUE, FIRST_PIN_CARD_ISSUE, CARD_REPLACEMENT, PIN_CARD_REPLACEMENT, PIN_REMINDER, PIN_REORDER, TAN_REQUEST, ORDER_CANCELLATION

statusHistory.description:
List of order status history data
Refer to OrderStatusHistory data type for detail information

cardProducer.description:
It is the card producer or embosser.
It is present if it is different than the default one (defined in the card profile) and was provided when requesting the card creation.
The list of allowed card producer is configurable per issuer.

pinMailerEditor.description:
It is the PIN mailer printer.
It is present if it is different than the default one (defined in the card profile) and was provided when requesting the card/PIN creation.
The list of allowed PIN mailer editors is configurable by issuer.

deliveryBranchCode.description:
Code of the delivery branch (mandatory only if card delivery type is BRANCH)
The list of issuer branches is configurable  per Issuer.
The branch code is used to access a preconfigured Postal address (configured in the system).

customDeliveryAddressee.description:
Name of addressee for the custom address.
Postal recipient’s name used for delivery, usually cardholder’s full name.

customDeliveryAddress.description:
Custom postal address to send the card
Refer to MailAddress data type for detail information

customDeliveryPhone.description:
Custom phone to send the card.
NOT USED

customDeliveryEmail.description:
Custom email to send the card.
NOT USED

specificFields.description:
List of external data (label:value), separated by a "|'", related to an order that can be provided by e.g. the issuer for information or for usage by other systems.
Example : label1:value|label2:value
Those provided data have no impact on our system business processes.

tanOrigin.description: Origin of the TAN request, e.g. GUI. (free text)

tanExpiryDate.description: Expiry date of the TAN, date until which the TAN can used (mandatory for TanMailerOrder)

tanStatus.description:
Status of the TAN (mandatory for TanMailerOrder)
Possible values: CREATED, FAILED, ACTIVE, USED, EXPIRED

tanUsageDate.description: Date when the TAN was used to change the PIN (optional)

free.description: Indicates if the operation is free (true) or not (false). Default value is false (mandatory)

tanValue.description: Clear value of the TAN (mandatory for TanMailerOrder)

feeConditions.description: Conditions of the fee generation (if fee configured in the product) (optional)

notExtractedReason.description: In case the order will not be extracted because of invalid customer address, then it will be indicated in this field

notExtractedUpdateDate.description: The last update date of notExtractedReason field

waitingPin.description:
This flag is used only for a card order or a PIN mailer order.
- If this flag is true, the PIN is waiting to be provided by the cardholder (the mode “Self Selected Pin” is activated in the PIN production model). Depending on the configuration, after x days, the card is extracted with a default PIN if the cardholder has not provided a PIN.
- If this flag is false, the PIN is not waiting to be provided , e.g. the PIN has been generated by PMM or provided by the cardholder.

orderReference.description:
The reference of the order in our system, unique per platform
This reference is calculated from an algorithm configurable per issuer (currently a unique algorithm is defined).
The reference is composed of the  creation date of the order (YYYYMMDD) + a sequence number of 16 digits (e;g; 202203212000000000097002, where 20220321 is the date when the order is created)

type.description:
Type of the history order status (mandatory)
Possible values: InternalStatus or ProducerStatus

date.description: Date of the history order status (mandatory)

status.description:
Status of the history order (mandatory)
The possible values are the same the ones defined for the current internal status and the current external status depending on the type of the order status.

countryCode.description: Country dialing code (optional). Free text. It is recommended to provide a region dialing code (e.g. +33, +49).

localPhoneNumber.description:
Free text (mandatory). It’s recommended to provide an international phone number in accordance with the value provided in the country code.
Ex : 
- country code = ‘+’33’ and localPhoneNumber = ‘0622334455’ 
- country code = empty and localPhoneNumber = ‘+33622334455’
The value can be subject to a validation process if a specific rule has been configured at issuer level.

issuerProductExternalReference.description: Product External Reference provided by the issuer

sendingMode.description: The issuer must provide a sending mode among ones allowed.

deliveryType.description:
Indicates whether the delivery of the PIN mailer should be to branch or customer (instead of the one from the distribution rule of the card product)
Possible values are: CUSTOMER, BRANCH
To override the delivery address, the card delivery type must not be provided and only one of these fields must be provided: customDeliveryAddress, customDeliveryEmail or customDeliveryPhone.

deliveryBranchCode.description:
The issuer must provide the card delivery branch code If the delivery type is provided and is BRANCH.
Not to be provided if the delivery type is different from BRANCH (ignored if provided and not needed).

customDeliveryAddressee.description: Can be provided in case of customised delivery address.

customDeliveryAddress.description:
Custom postal address to send the PIN mailer.
To be provided when delivery type is empty, but not in combination with Email for PIN and/or Phone for PIN.

customDeliveryEmail.description:
Custom email address to send the PIN mailer
To be provided when delivery type is empty, but not in combination with Phone for PIN and/or Postal address for PIN.

customDeliveryPhone.description:
Custom phone number to send the PIN mailer
To be provided when delivery type is empty, but not in combination with Email for PIN and/or Postal address for PIN.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can update the list of external data related to the order during the PIN reminding.
A new data can be added or an existing data can be updated (label1 = new value) or removed ( (label1 = null).
Any existing data that is not present in this list is not updated in the card contract. 
Refer to Order.specificFields

resetPinTryCounter.description: A reset of the PIN try counter can be requested (message is sent to the Front Office to reset the PIN).

waiveFee.description: Indicates if the configured fee (if any) is waived (true) or not (false) while reminding PIN. By default is false.

orderIdentifier.description: Order reference calculated by our system. Refer to Order.orderIdentifier

currentInternalStatus.description:
Current internal status of the order after the remind PIN request
- CONFIRMED: if the order is validated by the branch
- ORDERABLE: if ready to be issued (depending on the configuration, e.g. PIN is generated and available)

serviceTypeReference.description: Reference of the type of add-on service.

accountIdentifier.description:
The reference of the Account for which to unsubscribe from the add-on.
*One of cardContractIdentifier/ accountIdentifier must be provided.

cardContractIdentifier.description:
The reference of the CardContract for which to unsubscribe from the add-on.
*One of cardContractIdentifier/ accountIdentifier must be provided.

addonReference.description: Reference of the type of add-on service.

accountIdentifier.description: The accountIdentifier of the Account on which the subscription has been done

cardContractIdentifier.description: The cardContractIdentifier of the Card Contract on which the subscription has been done

sendingMode.description: Sending mode selected among the ones allowed by the card product

deliveryType.description:
Indicates whether the delivery of the PIN mailer should be to branch or customer (instead of the one from the distribution rule of the card product)
Possible values are: CUSTOMER, BRANCH
To override the delivery address, the delivery type must not be provided and only one of these fields must be provided: customDeliveryAddress, customDeliveryEmail or customDeliveryPhone.

deliveryBranchCode.description:
Delivery branch code to be provided (among the ones configured for the issuer) if the delivery type is BRANCH.
Not to be provided if the delivery type is different from BRANCH (ignored if provided and not needed).

customDeliveryAddressee.description:
Addressee for customized PIN mailer delivery address.
Postal recipient’s name used for delivery, usually card holder’s full name.

customDeliveryAddress.description:
Custom postal address to send the PIN mailer.
To be provided when delivery type is empty, but not in combination with Email for PIN and/or Phone for PIN.

customDeliveryEmail.description:
Custom email address to send the PIN mailer.
To be provided when delivery type is empty, but not in combination with Phone for PIN and/or Postal address for PIN.

customDeliveryPhone.description:
Custom phone number to send the PIN mailer.
To be provided when delivery type is empty, but not in combination with Email for PIN and/or Postal address for PIN.

specificFields.description:
List of external data (label:value), separated by a '|', related to an order that can be provided by e.g. the issuer for information or for usage by other systems.
Those provided data have no impact on our system business processes.

deliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel for pin mailer order among the channels configured for the issuer (if any).

waiveFee.description: Indicates if the configured fee (if any) is waived (true) or not (false) while reordering PIN. By default is false.

currentInternalStatus.description: Current internal status of the order (mandatory).

repaymentAmount.description: Amount that will reduce the remaining principal amount(conditional). Mandatory for extra repayments.

remainingCreditInstalmentReimbursementOp.description: Repayment option for the remaining credit instalment: issuer (outstanding amount repaid by bank/issuer) or via paying account (outstanding amount repaid by customer.

instalmentContractIdentifier.description: External Reference of the Instalment Contract.

contractStatus.description:
The status of instalment contract. 
Values=
CREATED,
ACTIVE,
CLOSED,
CANCELED

contractStatusDate.description: The date of the last instalment contract status is changed.

invoiceDate.description: Scheduled date to post the repayment

postIndicator.description:
It indicates if the repayment is posted to the customer (in the case of payment by card account, this indicator indicates if the instalment operation is posted to the paying account). Possible values are
PENDING= Not yet posted, invoice date not yet reached
POSTED_SUCCESS= Posted with success
POST_REJECTED = Post rejected by the paying account

waiveFee.description:
Indicates if the configured fee (if any) is waived (true) or not (false) while replacing card.
By default is false.

replacementReason.description:
Reason of the card replacement
Refer to Card.replacementReason

forceNewPin.description: The attribute can be set to true when a new pin change is needed in the process of replacing a card and it is not foreseen by default process (it is not possible however to inhibit the new pin change if it is foreseen by the default process)

specificFields.description:
The issuer can update the list of external data related to the card contract during the card replacement.
A new data can be added or an existing data can be updated (label1 = new value) or removed ( (label1 = null).
Any existing data that is not present in this list is not updated in the card contract.
Refer to CardContract.specificFields

cardHolder.description: Card holder data to update before replacing the card (in related customer resource having customerIdentifier equals to CardContract.cardHolderIdentifier). Only the fields provided in request will be updated, others will remain unchanged.

selectedModels.description: The issuer can replace one or several models linked to the card contract if this latest is active (only applicable for TECHNOLOGY_AND_APPLICATION_MODEL for the moment)

pan.description: The issuer can provide the Primary Account Number (PAN) or card number of the new card  if this is allowed by the product configuration only (allowed by the numbering model and the replacement reason). The provided PAN must belong to the card product BIN range.

issuerCardExternalReference.description: The issuer can provide the Issuer Card External Reference for the new card.

expiryDate.description:
The issuer can provide the expiry date of the new card if allowed by the product (replacement model).
Format is MMYY (month and year)

embossingName.description:
The issuer can provide the embossing mame (first line of the name embossed on the physical card) for the new card if allowed within card Technology and Application model.
By default, the previous value is used.
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 1 of the embossing name.

embossingName2ndLine.description:
The issuer can provide the 2nd Line of embossing name for the new card if the first line of embossing name is provided and if it is allowed by the embossing name calculation algorithm.
By default, the previous value is used.
The character "*" is not allowed in the line 2 of the embossing name.

embossingLine5.description:
The issuer can provide the embossing line 5 (additional embossing line) for the new card.
By default, the previous value is used.

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the list of external data for the new card.
Refer to Card.specificFields

cardOrder.description: Card Order for the new card

pinMailerOrder.description: Pin Mailer Order for the new card

encryptedPin.description: Encrypted Pin for the new card

blockingReason.description: When replacing a card, the issuer can temporarily block the card immediately after issuing, providing temporary blocking reason only. This can happen, for example, if the cardholder was not properly authenticated (or for other business reason). The card will be activated when, for instance, the cardholder calls the contact center and passes the respective procedures.

externalCobadgedCardNumber.description: This is an external card number used for Giro card in Germany.

externalCobadgedExpiryDate.description: Indicates which card deactivation rule is enabled for the card. It overrides the product card deactivation rule Possible value : FIRST_APPROVED_AUTHO (1st approved online authorization)

cardDeactivationRuleOverride.description:
Indicates which card deactivation rule is enabled for the card.
								It overrides the product card deactivation rule
								Possible value :
							•FIRST_APPROVED_AUTHO (1st approved online authorization))

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the list of external data for the pin mailer order.
Refer to Order.specificFields

cardProducer.description: The issuer can indicate a card producer (to be used instead of the default one from card profile).

sendingMode.description:
The issuer must provide the sending mode for a physical card if no default sending mode is defined for the replacement reason in the replacement model.
In the other cases, the sending mode is optional (for a virtual card or if the skipCardOrderGeneration field is set to true or for a physical card if a default sending mode has been defined for the replacement reason).

deliveryChannel.description:
The issuer can provide the delivery channel if a creation of a card order is requested (if skipCardOrderGeneration field is set to false).
By default, the delivery channel from the distribution rule of the card product will be used.

deliveryType.description:
Indicates whether the delivery of the card should be to branch or customer (instead of the one from the distribution rule of the card product)
Possible values are: CUSTOMER, BRANCH
To override the delivery address, the card delivery type must not be provided and only one of these fields must be provided: customDeliveryAddress, customDeliveryEmail or customDeliveryPhone.

deliveryBranchCode.description:
The issuer must provide the card delivery branch code if the delivery type is BRANCH.
Refer to Order.deliveryBranchCode

skipCardOrderGeneration.description:
Card order will be not generated if this field is true.
If this field is false or empty, the card order will be generated as per the product configuration.
By default, value is false.

pinBlockFormat.description: Format of the encrypted PIN (e.g. ISO-1-BAPOF)

pinAlgorithmId.description:
The encryption algorithm identifier:
- format numeric-2
- value '05' = BAPOF

key.description: This is the session key (can be provided)

keyId.description:
Encryption key identifier
Format: numeric-2
Current possible values: ‘01’, ‘02’ (this list depends on number of keys configured in the HSM)

sendingMode.description:
The issuer must provide the sending mode for a physical card if no default sending mode is defined for the replacement reason in the replacement model.
In the other cases, the sending mode is optional (for a virtual card or if the skipPinMailerOrderGeneration field is set to true or for a physical card if a default sending mode has been defined for the replacement reason).

deliveryChannel.description:
The issuer can provide the delivery channel if a creation of a PIN order is requested (if the skipPinMailerOrderGeneration field is set to false).
By default, the delivery channel from the distribution rule of the card product will be used.

deliveryType.description:
Indicates whether the delivery of the PIN should be to branch or customer (instead of the one from the distribution rule of the card product)
Possible values are: CUSTOMER, BRANCH
To override the delivery address, the pin mailer delivery type must not be provided and only one of these fields must be provided: customDeliveryAddress, customDeliveryEmail or customDeliveryPhone.

deliveryBranchCode.description:
The issuer must provide the PIN delivery branch code if the delivery type is BRANCH.
Refer to Order.deliveryBranchCode

specificFields.description:
The issuer can provide the list of external data for the pin mailer order.
Refer to Order.specificFields

skipPinMailerOrderGeneration.description:
Pin mailer will be not generated if this field is true.
If this field is false or empty, the pin mailer order will be generated as per the product configuration.
By default, value is false.

replacementForCardStatus.description: Card Status of the replaced card

replacementReason.description: Replacement Reason provided in the request

cardReplacementDateTime.description: System Date time when the card is replaced by our system

newRelatedCardList.description:
List of cards linked to the replaced card that have been replaced as well (cards from multi cards product)
For each replaced card, information such as card status, cardReference/issuerCardExternalReference, replacement reason, card replacement date and time is returned, new PAN.

pan.description: PAN of the new card

maskedPan.description: Masked PAN of the new card

expiryDate.description:
Expiry Date of the new card
Format is MMYY (month and year).

panSequenceNumber.description: Pan Sequence Number of the new card

status.description: Card status of the new card (CREATED or ACTIVE, depending on the configuration of the card creation model)

automaticDeactivationDate.description: Automatic deactivation date of the replaced card. Relevant if the feature is enabled for the issuer.

requestedDate.description: The date of the reprinting request (mandatory)

accountIdentifier.description: Refer to Account.accountIdentifier attribute

responseDateTime.description: Timestamp when response date was generated

timeTakenMs.description: Wall clock time required from service to generate the response

reversalReason.description:
The reason why the reversal has been created. 
Possible values:
DISPUTE_RESULT,
FRAUDULENT_OPERATION,
INVALID_ACQUISITION,
MERCHANT_REVERSAL,
TIME_OUT,
DD_REJECTED,
FREE_OPE_OVERFLOW,
REVERSAL_ON_DEMAND,
REVERSAL_FROM_CORRECTION,
OCT_REJECTED,
REVERSAL_REPROCESSING

description.description:
Textual description of the operation
Can contain a free text that can be used when the operation is presented to the Customer.

externalMatchingOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system. 
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed. 
The field contains the value of externalOperationReference of the original operation to be reversed.

externalMatchingOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system. 
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationDate of the original operation to be reversed.

externalMatchingOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalMatchingOperationDate, externalMatchingOperationReference, externalMatchingOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the original operation in our system. 
It is used for retrieving the operation to be reversed.
The field contains the value of externalOperationServicePoster of the original operation to be reversed.

referenceAmount.description:
The amount of the operation is requested for partial reversal (amount/exponent/currency values).
If not provided, the total amount of the original amount is reversed.

externalOperationReference.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
External reference of the operation to be created.

externalOperationDate.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The date the operation is performed.

externalOperationServicePoster.description:
The triplet (externalOperationDate, externalOperationReference, externalOperationServicePoster) uniquely identifies the operation in our system.
The identifier of the external system which provides the operation to be posted (free text).

operationIdentifier.description: Identifier of the created operation to reverse the balance adjustment

reversalReason.description:
The reason why the reversal has been created. 
Possible values:
DISPUTE_RESULT,
FRAUDULENT_OPERATION,
INVALID_ACQUISITION,
MERCHANT_REVERSAL,
TIME_OUT,
DD_REJECTED,
FREE_OPE_OVERFLOW,
REVERSAL_ON_DEMAND,
REVERSAL_FROM_CORRECTION,
OCT_REJECTED,
REVERSAL_REPROCESSING

operationIdentifier.description: Identifier of the created operation to reverse the payment

pan.description: Primary Account Number (PAN) also called card number (mandatory)

expiryDate.description:
Expiry date of the card.
Format is MMYY (month and year)

panSequenceNumber.description: Number identifying cards either with same PAN or with same PAN and same Expiry date (depending of the card product configuration), e.g 1

iban.description:
All the accounts  with the provided IBAN (exact matching) are selected to retrieve contracts.
Refer to Account.iban

retrievePreviousCards.description: If true, all cards of the card contract will be retrieved in cardContracts.cards else only the latest card issued (by PAN) in card contract will be available in response (only used when embed attribute cardContracts.cards is requested)

accountIdentifier.description: Refer to Account.accountIdentifier
Refer to Account.accountIdentifier

reprintHistory.description: Historic data of reprinting if any (optional),

creationDate.description: Date of creation of the statement (mandatory)

paymentDueDate.description: The date the payment is due.

directDebitAmount.description:
Amount of the direct debit that is issued for payment when the payment mode is autopayment (direct debit).
Depending on the issuer configuration, the direct Debit Amount can be different from the amount calculated at the cycle closure date (field theoricDirectDebitAmount) if credit operations (reversal, credit voucher…) are posted to the account between the cycle closure date and the date the direct debit is issued.

theoricDirectDebitAmount.description: Direct debit amount calculated at the cycle closure date when the payment mode is autopayment (direct debit) and depending on the payment conditions.

previousCycleBalance.description: Balance amount of the previous cyclic closure (start balance of the statement)

totalOfPayment.description: Sum of all payment operations received during the cycle.

previousCycleClosureDate.description: The closure date of the previous cycle (optional)

nextCycleClosureDate.description: The date of the next cycle closure (optional)

amountDue.description: Minimum payment amount calculated by our system depending  on the payment conditions of the customer (full payer/partial payer) the customer has to pay to reimburse his debt.

initialPastAmountDue.description: Remaining amount due of the previous cycle, set at cycle closure (optional, no past amount due for the first cycle or if the amount due was fully repaid for during the previous cycle).

initialRemainingAmountDue.description: Sum of the amountDue (minimum payment amount) of the cycle and the initialPastAmountDue (optional).

statementDuplicatedForCompany.description: Indicates if the company receives a duplicate for statement generated by other paying accounts in the corporate contract

iban.description: International Bank Account Number of the customer (debtor)

customerInfo.description: Key/value object, entries will be part of each notification for this subscription (max. length of the keys is 32 characters)

pushDeviceType.description: Type of (mobile) device (required if type is PUSH)

parameters.description: Optional list of parameters to customize the criteria values for events

contacts.description: List of addresses for an ALERT subscription (required if serviceType is ALERT)

events.description: List of events this subscription will be notified for

packet.description: ALERT packet name from the issuer configuration (required if serviceType is ALERT)

activationStartTime.description: Start date of the temporary credit limit (mandatory)

activationEndTime.description: End date of the temporary credit limit (mandatory)

temporaryCreditLimitAmount.description: Active temporary credit limit (it means that current date is between start date to end date) (mandatory)

accountIdentifier.description: Account references known in the system

root.description: Indicates if the account is a root account (true) or not (false).

payingAccountIdentifier.description: Paying account identifier of the instalment contract

closingReason.description: The reason of the closing the instalment contract. Free text is applied for input, no pre-defined list of possible values.

remainingCreditInstalmentReimbursementOp.description: Repayment option for the remaining credit instalment: either it is the 'issuer' (outstanding amount repaid by bank/issuer) or the 'customer' (outstanding amount repaid by customer)

creditInstalments.description: List of closed credit instalment contracts

instalmentContractIdentifier.description: External Reference of the Instalment Contract.

contractStatus.description:
The status of instalment contract (mandatory).
Values=
CREATED,
ACTIVE,
CLOSED,
CANCELED

contractStatusDate.description: The date the last instalment contract status is changed (mandatory)

closingReason.description: The reason of closing the instalment contract. Free text is applied for input, no pre-defined list of possible values.

remainingCreditInstalmentReimbursementOp.description: Repayment option for the remaining credit instalment: either it is the 'issuer' (outstanding amount repaid by bank/issuer) or the 'customer' (outstanding amount repaid by customer)

instalmentContractIdentifier.description: External Reference of the Instalment Contract.

contractStatus.description:
The status of instalment contract.
Values=
CREATED,
ACTIVE,
CLOSED,
CANCELED

contractStatusDate.description: The date of the last instalment contract status is changed

correlationId.description: Wall clock time required from service to generate the response

responseDateTime.description: Timestamp when response date was generated

pan.description:
The issuer provides the pan to unblock all the cards having this PAN. Mandatory if pan reference is not provided.
Refer to Card.pan

comment.description: Comment to be provided when unblocking the card

cancelScheduledCardBlocking.description:
Flag indicating the scheduled blocking is cancelling
False by default
- If True, scheduled card blocking is cancelled if any
- If false, scheduled card blocking is kept if any

unblockingReason.description:
Unblocking reason (optional)
Possible values : TEMPORARY_UNBLOCK,  FALSE_POSITIVE (Those values are mainly used in the context of Fraud management)

cards.description: List of cards and associated data

status.description: Card status after the unblocking request  (ACTIVE)

comment.description: Comment for unblocking the card provided in the request

cardUnblockingDateTime.description: Date and time when the card has been unblocked in the system

comment.description: Comment to be provided when unblocking the card

cancelScheduledCardBlocking.description:
Flag indicating the scheduled blocking is cancelling
False by default
- If True, scheduled card blocking is cancelled if any
- If false, scheduled card blocking is kept if any

unblockingReason.description:
Unblocking reason (optional)
Possible values : TEMPORARY_UNBLOCK,  FALSE_POSITIVE (Those values are mainly used in the context of Fraud management)

status.description: Card status after the unblocking request  (ACTIVE)

comment.description: Comment provided in the request for the card unblocking

cardUnblockingDateTime.description: Date and time when the card has been unblocked in the system

amount.description:
Cumulated authorization amount in period. Debits have a positive sign whereas credits have a negative one. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

count.description:
minimum: 0
maximum: 999999999
Current number of transactions in period. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

maximumAmount.description:
minimum: -1000000000000000000
maximum: 1000000000000000000
Maximum threshold for the cumulated authorization amount in period. 
In most of the cases the value given here will be positive. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. 
Only present in case MaximumAmountCheck is true.

maximumAmountCheck.description:
Indicates whether the cumulated authorization amount in period is compared with a maximum threshold or not. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

maximumAmountCheckOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MaximumAmountCheck has been taken.

maximumAmountOrigin.description:
Indicates from which level MaximumAmountCheck has been taken
Only present in case MaximumAmount is present.
Enum:
[ Default, Exception, Override, Other ]

maximumCount.description:
minimum: 0
maximum: 999999999
Maximum threshold for the number of transactions in period. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. Only present in case MaximumCountCheck is true.

maximumCountCheck.description:
Indicates whether the number of transactions in period is compared with a maximum threshold or not. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

maximumCountCheckOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MaximumCountCheck has been taken.

maximumCountOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MaximumCount has been taken.
Only present if the maximum count check has been performed.

minimumAmount.description:
minimum: -1000000000000000000
maximum: 1000000000000000000
Minimum threshold for the cumulated authorization amount in period. 
In most of the cases the value given here will be negative. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. 
Only present in case MinimumAmountCheck is true.

minimumAmountCheck.description:
Indicates whether the cumulated authorization amount in period is compared with a minimum threshold or not. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

minimumAmountCheckOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MinimumAmountCheck has been taken.

minimumAmountOrigin.description:
Indicates from which level MinimumAmountCheck has been taken.  
Possible values: Default, Exception, Override, Other.
Only present in case MinimumAmount is present.

minLength: 1
Descriptive text for the velocity limit, e.g. DAILY CASH

velocityLimitReference.description:
minLength: 1
maxLength: 60

Indicates from which entity MaximumAmountCheck has been taken.

maximumAmountOrigin.description:
Indicates from which level MaximumAmountCheck has been taken
Only present in case MaximumAmount is present.
Enum:
[ Default, Exception, Override, Other ]

maximumCount.description:
minimum: 0
maximum: 999999999
Maximum threshold for the number of transactions in period. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. Only present in case MaximumCountCheck is true.

maximumCountCheck.description:
Indicates whether the number of transactions in period is compared with a maximum threshold or not. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

maximumCountCheckOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MaximumCountCheck has been taken.

maximumCountOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MaximumCount has been taken.
Only present if the maximum count check has been performed.

minimumAmount.description:
minimum: -1000000000000000000
maximum: 1000000000000000000
Minimum threshold for the cumulated authorization amount in period. 
In most of the cases the value given here will be negative. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. 
Only present in case MinimumAmountCheck is true.

minimumAmountCheck.description:
Indicates whether the cumulated authorization amount in period is compared with a minimum threshold or not. 
The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

minimumAmountCheckOrigin.description:
Examples: List [ "Default", "Exception", "Override", "Other" ]
Indicates from which entity MinimumAmountCheck has been taken.

minimumAmountOrigin.description:
Indicates from which level MinimumAmountCheck has been taken.  
Possible values: Default, Exception, Override, Other.
Only present in case MinimumAmount is present.

activationEndTime.description: Last point in time at which the override will be considered. Has to be later than ActivationStartTime. Can be present without ActivationStartTime. If not provided the override will be taken into account forever.

activationStartTime.description: First point in time at which the override will be considered. Has to be before ActivationEndTime. Can be present without ActivationEndTime. If not provided the override will be taken into account immediately.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the override is still taken into account or has been deleted.

maximumAmount.description:
minimum: -1000000000000000000
maximum: 1000000000000000000
Maximum threshold for the cumulated authorization amount in period. In most of the cases the value given here will be positive. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. Only present in case MaximumAmountCheck is true.

maximumAmountCheck.description: Indicates whether the cumulated authorization amount in period is compared with a maximum threshold or not. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

maximumCount.description:
minimum: 0
maximum: 999999999
Maximum threshold for the number of transactions in period. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. Only present in case MaximumCountCheck is true.

maximumCountCheck.description: Indicates whether the cumulated authorization amount in period is compared with a maximum threshold or not. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

minimumAmount.description:
minimum: -1000000000000000000
maximum: 1000000000000000000
Minimum threshold for the cumulated authorization amount in period. In most of the cases the value given here will be negative. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time. Only present in case MinimumAmountCheck is true.

minimumAmountCheck.description: Indicates whether the cumulated authorization amount in period is compared with a minimum threshold or not. The returned value is the one being effective at operation execution time.

priority.description:
minimum: 0
maximum: 9999
In case multiple overrides with overlapping activation times are existing this information is used to resolve this situation by applying the overrides one by one starting with the one with lowest priority. The priority needs to be unique across all overrides associated with a velocity check and an account. Required field when inserting.

velocityLimitOverrideReference.description:
minLength: 1
maxLength: 100
Identifies the velocity limit override which replaces the default velocity limit.

disputeReason.description: Indicates the dispute reason. Example of values are : UNKNOWN_CARD, HIGH_AMOUNT, DUPLICATE_TRANSACTION, LATE_PRESENTMENT , INVALID_PAYMENT, INACTIVE_CARD, CREATED_CARD, COUNTERFEIT_CARD, BLOCKED_CARD, ACTIVE_CARD_TED.

refundRedebitIndicator.description:
Indicator to perform or not a Refund (for Debit transaction) / Redebit (for Credit transaction) on 'Cardholder Account' on the disputed transaction. Possible values:
- FULL: Refund Redebit the full amount of the transaction.
- PARTIAL : Refund Redebit a partial amount, the partial amount should be provided in the field Refund Redebit Amount
- NONE : no refund redebit is requested, this is the default value

refundRedebitAmount.description: The issuer should provide the Amount to Refund or Redebit when Refund Redebit Indicator is PARTIAL. Otherwise it is not checked

declareFraudIndicator.description:
Indicator to perform a fraud declaration. Possible values:
true: fraud declaration will be sent to the scheme.
false: No fraud declaration, this is the default value.

issuerDisputeExternalReference.description: The issuer Dispute External Reference : should be unique by issuer, there is no constraint regarding the format, only  maximum length is 50 CHAR.

disputePostings.description:
Issuer can provide a posting operation to perform on the created dispute folder, example:
- Do a refund towards the cardholder account
- Do a write-off towards an issuer account (Profit and Loss, Fraud,..)
- do a Foreign exchange fee, Financial Advice Exchange Rate Difference

disputeEvents.description:
Issuer can provide an event to add to the created dispute folder.
This manual event will be added to events generated internally by our system.
For example, the issuer can add an event to indicate that there is a communication from/to cardholder.

disputeDocuments.description: Issuer can provide a list of Documents to add to the created dispute folder.

disputePostings.description:
Issuer can provide a posting operation to perform on the created dispute folder, example:
- Do a refund towards the cardholder account
- Do a write-off towards an issuer account (Profit and Loss, Fraud,..)
- do a Foreign exchange fee, Financial Advice Exchange Rate Difference

disputeEvents.description:
Issuer can provide an event to add to the created dispute folder.
This manual event will be added to events generated internally by our system.
